en: “Tell the Israelites: When a woman becomes pregnant and gives birth to a male child,   she will be unclean seven days, as she is during the days of her menstrual impurity.  # 12:2 Lv 15:19

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ púʼu múɔ na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ lefɔ̌ɔn.
en: The flesh of his foreskin   must be circumcised  # 12:3 Gn 34:14 on the eighth day.  # 12:3 Gn 17:12–13; 21:4; Lk 2:21; Gl 3:5; 5:6; 6:15

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, mápfò gíŋe ńnéŋe ndá melyɛ̌ʼ láʼ ntsɔ̀b tá lé móm tá lélɔg sɔg ncÿǒ we metse mie à ka pyě fʉ̀ʼ gie à ka zyě, á le láʼ ńkíbe mmó gie áa ye Ssé wɔ́, é ké le gʉa jʉʼ gie áa ye Ssé wɔ́, tà láʼ kúu na melyɛ̌ʼ mie lesɔ̀g ncÿǒ na yé mǎg.
en: She will continue in purification   from her bleeding  # 12:4 Lk 8:43 for thirty-three days. She must not touch any holy thing or go into the sanctuary until completing her days of purification.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńzyé múɔ manzwě, mbà à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ gẅie ncÿǒ ée na yé, á na mengàba láʼ mémbʉ́a, páʼ à zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie à ne ńgyá saŋ we; à ge láʼ gíŋe ńnéŋe melyɛ̌ʼ láʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lé móm ntɔgɔ́ lélɔg sɔg ncÿǒ we metse mie à ka pyě fʉ̀ʼ gie à ka zyě.
en: But if she gives birth to a female child, she will be unclean for two weeks as she is during her menstrual impurity. She will continue in purification from her bleeding for sixty-six days.

ngiemboon: Manzwě gẅie à zyé múɔ mbàŋa kà múɔ manzwě wɔ́ɔ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie melyɛ̌ʼ lésɔg ncÿǒ na yé é mǎg, mbà à ge gʉa mvfò nùŋepwɔʼ, á ncwò ntàb mbumté. É gwaa tó, é gẅiin múɔ njʉ̀njÿò gẅie à gẅiin tàʼ ngùʼ lélɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ tá é pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńgÿo tàʼ kàpʉ̀ŋ kà tàʼ ngábnzsè wɔ́ɔ lélɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa.
en: “When her days of purification are complete, whether for a son or daughter, she is to bring to the priest at the entrance to the tent of meeting a year-old male lamb for a burnt offering, and a young pigeon or a turtledove for a sin   offering.

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ ge lɔg pɛ̌ menɔ̀ɔn é tóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é gÿo mmó gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo na mápfò, tá à cʉa púʼu á le gíŋe ngwɔ́ nyìŋ ncÿǒ ńtí metse mie é ka kẅɛɛ na yé wɔ́.
en: He will present them before the Lord and make atonement on her behalf; she will be clean from her discharge of blood. This is the law for a woman giving birth, whether to a male or female.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ḿbiŋ te gẅiin mmó gie ngwɔ́ à lɔg ńjú njʉ̀njÿò wɔ́, mbà à ge lɔg ngábnzsè yépʉ́a kà kàpʉ̀ŋ sépʉ́a wɔ́ɔ, é tó: tàʼ gwɔ́ ye lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, yetsɔ́ e gwɔ́ we pwɔʼ lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa. Anùŋepwɔʼ ge gÿo mmó gie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo na mápfò, tà á le gíŋe ńgẅiin ncÿǒ wɔ́, tá à cʉa púʼu, à le gíŋe ńgẅiin ncÿǒ we metse gẅie à ka gẅiin wɔ́.
en: But if she doesn’t have sufficient means  ,# 12:8 Lv 14:21 for a sheep, she may take two turtledoves or two young pigeons,  # 12:8 Lk 2:24 one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. Then the priest will make atonement on her behalf, and she will be clean.”
